class mlops_client.datasource.datasource_client.Datasource(headers: Dict[str, str], host: str, client: Optional[aiohttp.client.ClientSession] = None)¶
async create(dstype: mlops_client.datasource.datasource_type.DatasourceType, authentication: Optional[Union[mlops_client.datasource.gcp_authentication.GCPAuthentication, mlops_client.datasource.redshift_authentication.RedshiftAuthentication]], description: str, csv_file_path: Optional[str] = None) → Any¶

Creates a new datasource object on your account at Elemeno MLOps

Parameters:

dstype: The type of data source you want to use authentication: The credentials that will allow the platform to handle your data. Should be None when the type is CSV description: A short description of your datasource, so that you can find it later csv_file_path: Only required when type is CSV

Returns:

The json object with the result. If it fails, this method will raise an Exception

async list(offset: Optional[str] = None, limit: Optional[int] = None) → Any¶

Lists all datasources.

Parameters:
offset: An optional string that is used for pagination. It indicates the

first element that should be returned (0-based).

limit: An optional integer that is used for pagination. It indicates the

maximum number of elements to return.

Returns:

A list of datasources.

async remove(id: str) → Any¶

Removes a datasource.

Parameters:

id: The datasource id.

Returns:

The datasource.

Datasource API¶

Elemeno MLOps Python Client
